docs.lead_paragraph: An article on Wednesday about the hidden fees in health care misstated the name of a company in San Francisco that hopes to help people estimate ahead of time what prices have been negotiated and what they would pay for services outside an insurance network. It is Ventana, not Ventura.

headline.main: Building on Success in North Korea
headline.print_headline: Building on Success in North Korea

docs.lead_paragraph: Even before the last wisps of bipartisanship were evaporating from the health care debate, Senator Jim DeMint, Republican of South Carolina, had made clear he opposed President Obama's overhaul effort. It was Mr. DeMint who declared last month, ''If we're able to stop Obama on this, it will be his Waterloo.'' Now, you can watch Mr. DeMint as he tries to ride the road to Waterloo. On Thursday night, the senator plans a virtual town hall meeting from 6 to 7 p.m. He will take questions via Twitter and UStream.
docs.abstract: Sen James DeMint plans virtual town hall meeting during which he will take questions concerning health care overhaul; has warned that Pres Obama's overhaul plan would mean too much government interference in health care; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: A top Senate Democrat is not optimistic that major changes to the health care system can be achieved this year. Speaking to a small, friendly group of about 35 people at home in Wisconsin on Monday, the senator, Herb Kohl, said that a health care revamping ''won't be earth-shattering'' because ''there are too many politics involved,'' The Eau Claire Leader-Telegram reported.

headline.main: A Vote to Debate, Not Settle

docs.abstract: Sen Herb Kohl is not optimistic that major changes to health care system can be achieved this year, but he favors allowing debate in Congress to continue as long as necessary; is not crucial player in health care debate, but he is sort of solidly liberal Democrat whose vote could be crucial to passage of bill over Republican opposition; photo (M)
docs.snippet: A top Senate Democrat is not optimistic that major changes to the health care system can be achieved this year.      Speaking to a small, friendly group of about 35 people at home in Wisconsin on Monday, the senator, Herb Kohl, said that a health...

docs.lead_paragraph: Perhaps sensing that insurers are winning the health care debate, top House Democrats are demanding to look inside industry executives' wallets. The House Energy and Commerce Committee has sent letters to the 52 largest insurers, asking them to detail the salaries, bonuses and stock options they pay their executives and to itemize the companies' revenue and profits. The committee is one of three House panels that have drafted legislation to overhaul the health care industry and rein in insurers.
docs.abstract: House Energy and Commerce Committee asks 52 largest health insurers to provide details about executive salaries, bonuses and stock options and to itemize company revenue and profits; Rep Bart Stupak says goal is to determine whether rise in premiums corresponds to increase in care or simply pads companies' earnings (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama cast his efforts to overhaul America's health care system in moral terms in a conference call with liberal religious organizations late Wednesday afternoon, saying "these struggles always boil down to a contest between hope and fear."

headline.main: Obama Casts Health Effort in Moral Terms

docs.abstract: Obama, in conference call with religious leaders, talks about a health care overhaul in terms of faith.
docs.snippet: Obama, in conference call with religious leaders, talks about a health care overhaul in terms of faith.

docs.lead_paragraph: Earlier today we posted some interactive maps showing state-by-state health care spending per capita, life expectancy and healthy behaviors. A reader wisely suggested I create a scatterplot with the data to provide a better view of their big-picture relationships. In response, I've whipped up a few graphs that examine these variables, as well as how they're affected by the competitiveness of a given state's health insurance market.

headline.main: Reader Response: Health Care Costs, Habits, Longevity and Insurance Competition

docs.abstract: Examining state health care patterns, including competitiveness in the health insurance market, and how they relate to one another.
docs.snippet: Examining state health care patterns, including competitiveness in the health insurance market, and how they relate to one another.
